title: QOTD: What's Kept In Your Car?
description: Every week or so, I swap one test car for another. I dutifully lug a few small items -- usually sunglasses and a parking pass for my garage -- from one to the other. Doing this mundane, boring ritual today I started thinking -- what do you keep IN your car?
author: Tim Healey
excerpt: Every week or so, I swap one test car for another.I dutifully lug a few small items -- usually sunglasses and a parking pass for my garage -- from one to the other.Doing this mundane, boring ritual today I started thinking -- what do you keep IN your car?
text: ... not that mess ... spare baerskin hoodie, toothbrush, toothpaste, 100 asprin, 50 ibuprofen, 10 aleeve, 50 vitamin gummies, non-digital tire pressure gauge, viar 400 air pump, ball bearings, cargo net, red-n-tacky spray lube, usb-c cables, usb-b cables, 4 sterno cans, matches, more matches, butane torch, magnesium, flash powder, cheap duct tape, HUGE zip ties, handheld CB, Boefang, tanerite, portable jump box, some cheap but bright af amazon led flashlight, 2 bottles of water, two powerade zero oranges, a glovebox full of half melted powerbars, maybe 4 dollars in quarters .. and other change, spare pants, spare shirt, spare socks and underwear, deodorant, a handful of scratched 5$ polarized fishing glasses from walmart, spare tablet, slugged m4, m&p 2.0 In my challenger not much- sunglasses, altoids, and the legal documents I'm required to have. In my gladiator I've got so much crap: binoculars, kinetic rope, winch controls, jump cables, ratchet straps, bungies, a tarp, bowshackles, scherber IFAK kit, flashlights, etc.
html:
... not that mess ...

spare baerskin hoodie, toothbrush, toothpaste, 100 asprin, 50 ibuprofen, 10 aleeve, 50 vitamin gummies, non-digital tire pressure gauge, viar 400 air pump, ball bearings, cargo net, red-n-tacky spray lube, usb-c cables, usb-b cables, 4 sterno cans, matches, more matches, butane torch, magnesium, flash powder, cheap duct tape, HUGE zip ties, handheld CB, Boefang, tanerite, portable jump box, some cheap but bright af amazon led flashlight, 2 bottles of water, two powerade zero oranges, a glovebox full of half melted powerbars, maybe 4 dollars in quarters .. and other change, spare pants, spare shirt, spare socks and underwear, deodorant, a handful of scratched 5$ polarized fishing glasses from walmart, spare tablet, slugged m4, m&p 2.0

In my challenger not much- sunglasses, altoids, and the legal documents I'm required to have. In my gladiator I've got so much crap: binoculars, kinetic rope, winch controls, jump cables, ratchet straps, bungies, a tarp, bowshackles, scherber IFAK kit, flashlights, etc.
